info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 7:46PM EDT until June 22 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON COUNTY IN NORTH CENTRAL MARYLAND... NORTHEASTERN ALLEGANY COUNTY IN WESTERN MARYLAND...NORTHEASTERN FREDERICK COUNTY IN NORTHWESTERN VIRGINIA...MORGAN COUNTY IN THE PANHANDLE OF WEST VIRGINIA...EAST CENTRAL MINERAL COUNTY IN EASTERN WEST VIRGINIA...WESTERN BERKELEY COUNTY IN THE PANHANDLE OF WEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEASTERN HAMPSHIRE COUNTIES IN EASTERN WEST VIRGINIA... At 746 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Berkeley Springs to 6 miles east of Cumberland, moving south at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Romney, Hancock, Paw Paw, Greenwood, Berkeley Springs, Springfield, Great Cacapon, Green Spring, Flintstone, Oldtown, Little Orleans, Johnsons Mill, Valley View, Fishers Bridge, Spohrs Crossroads, Pumpkin Center, Oakland, Rock Gap, Bloomery and Points. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
